column4: ok, so now I have gotten vmware to uninstall and reinstall, but now it is not extracting and installing its /etc/init.d scripts
is there, perhaps, an "aptitude install --work-correctly" flag?
ok, what would cause a package to not install one of its files, yet still declare success?
I've never had a package give me this much trouble and I've been on debian based systems for years.
either purge it an reinstall, or there's a dpkg option re. missing conf files
hmm, is it part of the package or created by the postinstall?
it's created during the package setup script.
so the author was just too lazy to list it
that's likely a bug in the packaging then
no, there's reasons you don't want a config file to be actually in the package
it's relatively rare, but it happens
right, but when you build a pacakge, you typically want to make sure that it uninstalls completely.
